bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 30 (Thursday, February 15, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. TENNEY:H.R. 5063.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 18 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H1213]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

summary.text: Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 10565 Steuben Street in Remsen, New York, as the "Erin Hamlin Post Office."

bill.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 10565 Steuben Street in Remsen, New York, as the "Erin Hamlin Post Office".

To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 10565 Steuben Street in Remsen, New York, as the "Erin Hamlin Post Office".

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
